alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 3:27AM CDT until August 08 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Lincoln and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Chandler, Bethany, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Harrah, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Prague, Luther, Meeker, Wellston, Valley Brook and Arcadia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
